sentences: Expanding Opportunity — #KempForum16Let’s get the conversation going on how we can fight poverty and expand opportunity in America.
label: true_

sentences: The federal government has spent trillions of dollars.
label: true_

sentences: And yet today, if you were raised poor, you’re just as likely to stay poor as you were 50 years ago.I’m not saying we haven’t made progress.
label: true_

sentences: We have.
label: true_

sentences: But today we have a safety net that catches people falling into poverty.
label: true_

sentences: What we need is a safety net that lifts people out of poverty — that helps them earn a good paycheck so they can support themselves.
label: true_

sentences: So, what is the problem?It is our strategy.
label: true_

sentences: Most of us think poverty is about deprivation — or not having enough money.We treat empty wallets like potholes.
label: true_

sentences: Fill them up and move on.
label: true_

sentences: So for the past 50 years, we’ve created over 80 different programs to fill over 80 different holes in people’s budgets: health care,child care, energy, education — with almost no coordination among them.Here’s the catch: You qualify for these programs based how much you make.
label: true_

sentences: So if you don’t make much, you get a lot of benefits.
label: true_

sentences: But as you work and make more, you start to lose benefits.And because we’ve piled these programs right on top of each other, the falloff is steep.
label: true_

sentences: Make a little more, and you’ll lose a ton.
label: true_

sentences: So we think we’ve been filling holes.
label: true_

sentences: But we’ve actually been building a trap.
label: true_

sentences: And that’s because poverty is about more than deprivation; it’s about isolation.There are many different kinds of poverty.
label: true_

sentences: But what a lot of them share in common is, people are cut off from the community.
label: true_

sentences: They don’t have the support they need to grow, whether it’s a counselor, or a teacher, or a boss.What they need is someone they can trust, someone who can help them learn new skills.
label: true_

sentences: And by discouraging work, the federal government is isolating the poor.That’s why we are here today.
label: true_

sentences: We as a country are not winning this war, and we conservatives have something to offer.
label: true_

sentences: They’re the ones who can break through.
label: true_

sentences: Take the money we’re spending now and direct it to homegrown solutions.
label: true_

sentences: Design aid to fit each person’s needs.
label: true_

sentences: And whatever you do,encourage work — because that’s how people reconnect with their community.
label: true_

sentences: But the people in our communities — they’re the vanguard; they should fight poverty on the front lines.Now, I know a lot of people are wondering, “Why do you care about this?
label: true_

sentences: If you made a mistake, you can redeem yourself.But a lot of people don’t think that’s true anymore.
label: true_

sentences: And we have to be honest with ourselves: If the American Idea is not true for everybody, then it is not true at all.
label: true_

sentences: So we all should care about poverty because it is a direct challenge to who we are.And it’s not enough to pay your taxes and think, “Government is going to take care of this.” We all have to get involved.And I know it’s easy to get discouraged.
label: true_

sentences: The solutions are out there; they’re already working.
label: true_

sentences: We just have to support them.
label: true_

sentences: We just have to find them.
label: true_

sentences: And more often than not they’re right under our noses .
label: true_

sentences: . . in our communities .
label: true_

sentences: Join Senator Tim Scott and I as we moderate a forum on fighting poverty with Republican presidential candidates in Columbia, S.C., hosted by the Jack Kemp Foundation.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: Follow along here and on Twitter with #KempForum16.I just wanted to say a few words about why we’re here today.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: And one reason why I’m here is that my mentor was Jack Kemp.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: There was no issue he was more passionate about than poverty.So I couldn’t think of a better host than the foundation that bears his name.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: Jack was the greatest champion of the American Idea, and he knew the fight against poverty is vital to renewing that idea in the 21st century.We’ve been fighting the War on Poverty for 50 years now.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: And I don’t think you can call it anything but a stalemate.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: I believe if we apply our principles to this challenge, we can come up with real solutions.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: Don’t just treat the symptoms of poverty.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: Get at the root causes of poverty.Don’t measure success based on inputs.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: Measure the results.And this, to me, is the biggest conservative insight: The answer is not the money in Washington.It is the people in our communities — the people with credibility.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: And I’m not saying just cut money for the safety net.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: I’d say spend the same amount of money we do now — because this isn’t about saving money; it’s about saving lives.What I’m saying is, don’t minimize; customize.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: Once they find their niche and put down roots, they draw strength from the people around them, and they grow.They’ll not only have enough money; they’ll be able to make enough money to get off assistance.The way I see it, the federal government is the rearguard; it should direct the supply lines.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: But what I’ve learned is, there are thousands of people beating poverty every day.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: . . all over America.So I look forward to hearing from all our candidates and learning more about how we can build a more prosperous, a more secure, and a more confident America.
label: non_check_worthy

sentences: You’re Republicans.”I remind them, ‘Well, we’re Americans too.’ We all believe in the American Idea: The condition of your birth doesn’t determine the outcome of your life.If you work hard and play by the rules, you can get ahead.
